title: Rizal Law (RA 1425)
subtitle: Republic Act No. 1425 - An Act to Include in the Curricula

paragraphs: Republic Act No. 1425, known as the **Rizal Law**, was enacted on June 12, 1956. This law mandates the inclusion of courses on the life, works, and writings of Jos√© Rizal, particularly his novels *Noli Me Tangere* and *El Filibusterismo*, in the curricula of all public and private schools, colleges, and universities.
The law aims to rekindle the patriotic spirit of Filipino youth and inspire them with the ideals of freedom and nationalism that Rizal embodied.

objectives: To rededicate the lives of youth to the ideals of freedom and nationalism
To foster love of country, heroism, and national ideals
To gain an inspiring source of patriotism through the study of Rizal's life and works
To strengthen national consciousness and pride in being Filipino

educational_goals.title: Historical Consciousness and National Identity
educational_goals.description: Develops deep understanding of Philippine colonial history and the roots of Filipino nationalism
specific_outcomes: Understanding of Spanish colonial system and its impact on Filipino society
Knowledge of 19th century reform movements and their significance
Appreciation of the peaceful approach to social change advocated by Rizal
Recognition of continuity between past struggles and contemporary issues

educational_goals.title: Moral and Ethical Development
educational_goals.description: Instills fundamental Filipino values and universal ethical principles through Rizal's example
specific_outcomes: Love of country (patriotism) without hatred of other nations
Commitment to truth, justice, and human dignity
Importance of education and continuous learning
Courage to stand for principles despite personal cost
Respect for human rights and social justice

educational_goals.title: Critical Thinking and Analytical Skills
educational_goals.description: Develops intellectual abilities through examination of complex historical and literary texts
specific_outcomes: Analysis of primary source documents and historical evidence
Literary criticism and interpretation of novels and essays
Evaluation of different historical perspectives and narratives
Understanding of cause-and-effect relationships in history
Ability to connect past events with contemporary issues

educational_goals.title: Cultural Appreciation and Global Perspective
educational_goals.description: Strengthens Filipino cultural identity while promoting international understanding
specific_outcomes: Pride in Filipino heritage and cultural achievements
Understanding of cultural diversity and tolerance
Appreciation of Philippines' place in world history
Recognition of universal human values across cultures
Preparation for global citizenship and international cooperation

contemporary_relevance.title: Relevance to Modern Filipino Society:
applications: Social reform through peaceful and legal means
Cultural preservation in a globalized world
Ethical leadership in public and private sectors
International relations based on mutual respect

pedagogical_benefits.title: Educational and Pedagogical Value:
benefits: Integrates multiple disciplines: history, literature, philosophy, politics
Provides role models for Filipino youth
Encourages reading and appreciation of classic literature
Promotes discussion and debate on important issues
Connects academic learning with practical life applications

content.subtitle: AN ACT TO INCLUDE IN THE CURRICULA OF ALL PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS, COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES COURSES ON THE LIFE, WORKS AND WRITINGS OF JOSE RIZAL, PARTICULARLY HIS NOVELS NOLI ME TANGERE AND EL FILIBUSTERISMO, AUTHORIZING THE PRINTING AND DISTRIBUTION THEREOF, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES

sections.text: Courses on the life, works and writings of Jose Rizal, particularly his novels Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo, shall be included in the curricula of all schools, colleges and universities, public or private: Provided, That in the collegiate courses, the original or unexpurgated editions of the Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo or their English translation shall be used as basic texts.

It shall be obligatory on all schools, colleges and universities to keep in their libraries an adequate number of copies of the original and unexpurgated editions of the Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo, as well as of Rizal's other works and biography. The said unexpurgated editions of the Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo or their translations in English as well as other writings of Rizal shall be included in the list of approved books for required reading in all public or private schools, colleges and universities.

The Board of National Education is hereby authorized and directed to adopt forthwith measures to implement and carry out the provisions of this Section, including the writing and printing of appropriate primers, readers and textbooks. The Board shall, within sixty (60) days from the effectivity of this Act, promulgate rules and regulations, including those of a disciplinary nature, to carry out and enforce the provisions of this Act. The Board shall promulgate rules and regulations providing for the exemption of students for reasons of religious belief stated in a sworn written statement, from the requirement of reading the original and unexpurgated editions of the Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo. Such rules and regulations shall take effect thirty (30) days after their publication in the Official Gazette.

Nothing in this Act shall be construed as amendment or repealing section nine hundred twenty-seven of the Administrative Code, prohibiting the discussion of religious doctrines by public school teachers and other person engaged in any public school.
The sum of three hundred thousand pesos is hereby authorized to be appropriated out of any fund not otherwise appropriated in the National Treasury to carry out the purposes of this Act.
This Act shall take effect upon its approval.

levels.description: Introduction to Rizal's life story, heroism, and basic values through age-appropriate materials.
Comprehensive study of Rizal's biography, historical context, and selected works and writings.
Critical analysis of Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo, plus in-depth study of his philosophy and impact on Philippine society.
